experience: You and Patrik both know Eric Keosky-Smith, Amanda Vega, and 73 others
Patrik can introduce you to 2 people at PrizeLogic
TEACH:  It is the right thing to do - some of the most rewarding moments in our life will come of it

I help grow mission driven organizations GROW with intentional storytelling. I work with people to develop their story and help them tell it like a friend would. My typical day includes hashing out strategy with clients, shooting company documentaries or commercials and helping where I can to keep my operations and growth team on track for our long game vision of creating our own documentaries, tv shows and cinematic epics!

My job is to help the team with anything and everything I can so we have a successful app launch. My daily duties are managing our app's social strategy, managing our launch website, and providing any other necessary support to the team.

I was a one man show. Whether it was a simple contact form program or a full on wordpress e-commerce site. I did whatever I could to get my name out as a young eager entreprenuer. Along the way, not only did I learn a countless amount of information, but I also built a good reputation for working hard.

I had the wonderful privilege of working on contract during the company’s busy season. My duties were very straightforward. I would slice Photoshop Documents (Designs) and turn them into functioning interactive websites for promotions. Some notable projects I got to help the team work on:McDonalds Monopoly Online Game (I built the Winners Website and The Emails for the 2012 year)Subways 25th Anniversary (Build the Promotions main site along with the Emails)American Idol / Pepsi (Built a Microsite for users to tweet about the show from)Some others are AMPM (Gas Station), SPAM (The Canned Meat), Quaker Oats, and Mountain Dew.

The first 3 months of my internship was spent learning learning how websites were supposed to look and function visually, How to find errors in websites using quality assurance tools, and Learning HTML, CSS, and Javascript at a more advanced level.The last 4 months of my internship, my duties were to find and fix website errors using the skills I had learned in the previous three months.This was a great position for me. I really thank Honey, Asha, Glen, Tony, Haley,Glen, Paul, Chris, Michelle, Christine and Sudah for being so patient with me while I was learning!
